plants.name: Monsterra
plants.description: Monstera is a genus of 45 species of flowering plants in the arum family, Araceae, native to tropical regions of the Americas.

plants.name: Anturium2
plants.description: Anthurium is a genus of about 1,000 species of flowering plants, the largest genus of the arum family, Araceae.

plants.name: Spatifillum
plants.description: Spathiphyllum is a genus of about 47 species of monocotyledonous flowering plants in the family Araceae.

plants.name: Tradescantia Zebrina
plants.description: Tradescantia zebrina, formerly known as Zebrina pendula, is a species of spiderwort. It is sometimes known as inch plant, but its preferred common name is wandering jew.

plants.name: Cactus Cereus
plants.description: Cereus is a genus of cacti including around 33 species of large columnar cacti from South America. The name is derived from Greek and Latin words meaning .

plants.name: Chrysanthemum
plants.description: Chrysanthemums, sometimes called mums or chrysanths, are flowering plants of the genus Chrysanthemum in the family Asteraceae.

plants.name: Bull-de-Neige
plants.description: Boule de Neige is a mound-forming, evergreen shrub with ovate to obovate, dark green leaves and spherical clusters of wavy, funnel-shaped, lightly spotted, white flowers in mid-spring

plants.name: Croton
plants.description: Croton is an extensive flowering plant genus in the spurge family, Euphorbiaceae. The plants of this genus were described and introduced to Europeans by Georg Eberhard Rumphius
